physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal findings in electroencephalogram, nerve conduction studies, muscle biopsy, thyroid function tests, creatine phosphokinase, immunoprotein electrophoresis. Prominent cortical atrophy on MRI.
Increased tremor and rigidity; fine motor movements became more difficult. Neuropsychiatric testing revealed an IQ score of 77 (borderline intellectual functioning).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Tremor and rigidity increased compared to 1991.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Marked problems with expressive speech (stuttering and paraphasic errors). MRI findings indicated atrophy. Adjustments made to medications.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Speech problems and mental status continued to worsen compared to 1995.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: FDG-PET scan shows bilateral moderate to severe temporal and parietal cortical hypometabolism, rigidity worse on the right than the left, language disturbances.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Signs consistent with worsening condition, particularly rigidity.
Overall decline in physical and mental health leading to the patient's death.
